The meal typically starts with a variety of side dishes, known as "banchan," which can include:

* Kimchi (spicy fermented vegetables)
* Japchae (stir-fried glass noodles)
* Gyeranjjim (steamed eggs)
* Sigeumchi (boiled spinach)
* Bokkeumbap (fried rice)

The main course often features a variety of dishes, including:

* Jeyuk (braised pork belly)
* Galbi (grilled short ribs)
* Bulgogi (marinated beef)
* Jjamppong (spicy seafood noodle soup)

Desserts are also an important part of the festive meal, with popular options including:

* Patbingsu (shaved ice dessert with sweet red bean and fruit)
* Yaksik (sweet rice dish with honey and nuts)
* Hangwa (traditional Korean sweets)
